name: Partition
description: Reorders the elements in a list in such a way that all elements for which the predicate p returns true precede all elements for which predicate p returns false.
steps:
Let K be the first index whose element does not match a given predicate. If K does not exist, then the entire input is 
already partitioned and we can short-circuit.
For each index I > K: if input[I] matches predicate: swap input[K] and input[I], and increment K
example: Example: [1 2 3 4 5] > 3 means move all elements greater than 3 to the left side of the range
